basics.name: Matthias Cremieux
basics.label: Software Engineer in ML @ Mindee | Mines de Paris & DAC
basics.summary: Fresh Graduate of a three-year master’s programme in executive engineering at MINES ParisTech as well as a MSc at Sorbonne university in Stats and ML. I have a keen interest in software engineering, machine learning, deep learning, its related fields, and in a broader sense, in computer science in general !

work.name: Mindee
work.summary:
- Co-Development of a distributed computing library based on Directed Acyclic Graphs (https://github.com/mindee/tawazi)
- Development and optimization of a thread-safe inference framework for deep learning models in Python. Small experience with Cython.
- Deep learning model RAM and computation time optimization (Tensorflow, ONNX) on various hardwares.
- Deployment of applications with Kubernetes, Spinnaker and OpenLens.
- Troubleshooting of performance issues (Flamegraphs, ptrace, strace, perf...), memory and file descriptor leaks (C).
- Infrastructure and Deep learning models load testing (Locust, custom framework).

references.name: Arthur Labarre
references.reference: J’ai eu la chance de travailler avec Matthias de nombreuses années. Son impressionnante capacité de travail n’a d’égal que son sens de l’organisation. Dans un projet, Matthias prend les devants et est force de proposition en toutes circonstances, démontrant une capacité d’adaptation à toute épreuve. Je ne peux que vous recommander de travailler avec Matthias qui saura, j’en suis sûr, tirer vos projets vers le haut

projects.name: Mechatronics Project : "B.R.A.Voice" for IRCAM
projects.summary:
Design of an artificial mouth with a group of 12 students, in collaboration with students from BTS communication, BTS electronics and BTS mechanics.

- Equation of the main acoustic functions of the mouth.
- Running workshops to explain the project to secondary school students

projects.name: Research work on sociology
projects.summary:
This work was carried out as part of an intensive ‘Public Affairs and Innovation’ (API) course taught by research professors from the Centre de Sociologie de l'Iinnovation (CSI) at the Ecole des Mines de Paris, which aims to train engineering students in the political dimensions of large-scale industrial technical projects.

A study trip was made to French Guiana to conduct sociological research (using interviews) applied to the challenges of industrial mining in French Guiana.
